intro: Euphrasia umbellata, commonly known as the pretty willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a soft, velvety texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Euphrasia umbellata is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
